intro: Lotus argophyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf lotus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant features compound leaves with a silvery-gray underside, giving it its common name. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by water, contributing to its propagation in aquatic habitats.
